borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:
&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">Prior to commencement of the development, a Construction
Logistics Plan (CLP) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the
Council. The details shall include the numbers, size and routes of construction
vehicles, provisions within/around the site to ensure that all vehicles
associated with the construction works are properly managed to prevent any
unwanted disruption to other highway users, and other matters relating to
traffic management to be agreed with the licencing officers of the council.
Approved details shall be implemented throughout the project period and any
changes to the document must be reported back to the council’s planning and
highways department.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></p><p>

</p><p class="MsoNormal"><br></p>

<p><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ascii-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin">Prior
to commencement of the development the applicant must enter into an agreement
with the Council to acquire the right to obtain access across the strip of
land/verge to get direct access to the highway.</span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal">Prior to above ground works, full details of a scheme of acoustic
protection of habitable rooms against noise shall be submitted to and approved
in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; The scheme of acoustic
protection shall be sufficient to secure internal noise levels no greater than:<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:14.2pt;mso-add-space:auto;text-indent:
-14.2pt">a.&nbsp; 35 dB LAeq in living
rooms and bedrooms (07:00 hours to 23:00 hours) with windows closed; and<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">b.&nbsp; 30 dB LAeq
in bedrooms (23:00 hours to 07:00 hours) with windows closed.<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:72.0pt;mso-add-space:auto"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">Additionally, where
the internal noise levels will exceed 40 dB LAeq in living rooms and bedrooms
(07:00 hours to 23:00 hours) or 35dB LAeq in bedrooms (23:00 hours to 07:00
hours) with windows open the scheme of acoustic protection shall incorporate a
ventilator system which is commensurate with the performance specification set
out in Schedule 1 (paragraphs 6 and 7) of The Noise Insulation Regulations 1975
(as amended), and the Acoustic Ventilation and Overheating Residential Design
Guide January 2020. The approved scheme shall be fully implemented before the
first occupation of the residential unit to which it relates and shall be
maintained at all times thereafter.<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class="MsoNormal">No development shall commence until:<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">(a) a<span lang="EN-US">n
investigation and risk assessment, in addition to any assessment provided with
the planning application, has been completed in accordance with a scheme to
assess the nature and extent of any contamination on the site, whether or not
it originates on the site.&nbsp; The contents of the scheme are subject to the
approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; The investigation
and risk assessment must be undertaken by competent persons and a written report
of the findings must be produced.&nbsp; The written report is subject to the
approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; The report of the
findings must include:<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span lang="EN-US">&nbsp;</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:35.45pt;text-indent:-14.15pt;text-autospace:
none">(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; a survey of the extent, scale and nature of
contamination.<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:42.55pt;text-indent:-21.25pt;text-autospace:
none">(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; an assessment of the potential risks to human
health; property (existing or proposed) including buildings, crops, livestock,
pets, woodland and service lines and pipes; adjoining land; groundwaters and
surface waters; ecological systems; archaeological sites and ancient monuments;
and<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:35.45pt;text-indent:-14.15pt;text-autospace:
none">(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp; an appraisal of remedial options, and proposal of the
preferred option(s). <o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:35.45pt;text-indent:-14.15pt;text-autospace:
none"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">This must be conducted in
accordance with DEFRA and the Environment Agency’s ‘<span style="color: rgb(32, 33, 36); background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">Land Contamination Risk Management (LCRM)</span>’; and<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">(b)&nbsp;&nbsp; a detailed
remediation scheme, to bring the site to a condition suitable for the intended
use by removing unacceptable risks to human health, buildings and other
property and the natural and historical environment, has been prepared and submitted
to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing.&nbsp; The scheme must
include all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and
remediation criteria, timetable of works and site management procedures.&nbsp;
The scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land
under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the
intended use of the land after remediation. <o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">(c)&nbsp; The approved
remediation scheme must be carried out in accordance with its terms prior to
commencement of the development, other than that required to carry out
remediation, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning
Authority.&nbsp; The Local Planning Authority must be given two weeks written
notification of commencement of the remediation scheme works.<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">Following completion of measures
identified in the approved remediation scheme, a verification report that
demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be produced
and is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; The report shall include results of
sampling and monitoring carried out to demonstrate that the site remediation
criteria have been met.<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-right:19.3pt;text-autospace:none">(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;
In the event that contamination is found at any time when carrying out the
approved development that was not previously identified it must be reported in
writing immediately to the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; An investigation and
risk assessment must be undertaken in accordance with the requirements of (a),
and where remediation is necessary a remediation scheme must be prepared in
accordance with the requirements of (b), which is subject to the approval in
writing of the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; Following completion of measures
identified in the approved remediation scheme a verification report must be
prepared, which is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning
Authority.</p>

The development hereby approved shall only be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:

- DRAWING XXX REV XX DATED XX
- USE [SHIFT]+[ENTER] FOR REGULAR LINE SPACING
- USE [ENTER] FOR LARGER LINE SPACING

No other drawings or documents apply.
The development hereby permitted shall be commenced before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

<p>Prior to above ground works details of all hard and soft landscaping including details of all trees to be planted and a tree planting strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the LPA. The as approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation and retained thereafter for the duration of the lifetime.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Prior to above ground works details of all external facing materials shall be submitted and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The as approved materials shall be retained thereafter for the lifetime of the development.&nbsp;</p>

<p class="MsoNormal">No development shall commence, including any works of
demolition, until a Construction Environmental Management Plan (CEMP) and a
Site Waste Management Plan (SWMP) have been submitted to and approved in
writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; These Plans shall incorporate
details of:<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-right:19.3pt;text-autospace:none"><span lang="EN-US">&nbsp;</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:21.3pt;text-indent:-21.3pt;mso-list:l0 level2 lfo1"><!--[if !supportLists]-->a)<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span><!--[endif]-->construction traffic management.<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:21.3pt;text-indent:-21.3pt;mso-list:l0 level2 lfo1"><!--[if !supportLists]-->b)<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span><!--[endif]-->the parking of vehicles of site operatives and
visitors.<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:21.3pt;text-indent:-21.3pt;mso-list:l0 level2 lfo1"><!--[if !supportLists]-->c)<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span><!--[endif]-->loading and unloading of plant and materials.<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:21.3pt;text-indent:-21.3pt;mso-list:l0 level2 lfo1"><!--[if !supportLists]-->d)<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span><!--[endif]-->storage of plant and materials used in
constructing the development.<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:21.3pt;text-indent:-21.3pt;mso-list:l0 level2 lfo1"><!--[if !supportLists]-->e)<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span><!--[endif]-->the erection and maintenance of security
hoarding(s) including decorative displays and facilities for public viewing,
where appropriate;<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:19.3pt;margin-bottom:
0cm;margin-left:21.3pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-21.3pt;mso-list:l0 level2 lfo1"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span lang="EN-US">f)<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><!--[endif]-->wheel washing facilities.<span lang="EN-US"><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:19.3pt;margin-bottom:
0cm;margin-left:21.3pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-21.3pt;mso-list:l0 level2 lfo1"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span lang="EN-US">g)<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><!--[endif]--><span lang="EN-US">measures
to control the emission of dust, dirt and emissions to air during construction;
such measures to accord with the&nbsp;guidance provided in the document “The
Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition”, Mayor of
London, July 2014; including but not confined to, non- road mobile machinery
(NRMM) requirements.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:19.3pt;margin-bottom:
0cm;margin-left:21.3pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-21.3pt;mso-list:l0 level2 lfo1"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span lang="EN-US">h)<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><!--[endif]--><span lang="EN-US">noise
and vibration control.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:19.3pt;margin-bottom:
0cm;margin-left:21.3pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-21.3pt;mso-list:l0 level2 lfo1"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span lang="EN-US">i)<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><!--[endif]-->a scheme for recycling/disposing of waste
resulting from demolition and construction works.<span lang="EN-US"><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:21.3pt;text-indent:-21.3pt;mso-list:l0 level2 lfo1"><!--[if !supportLists]-->j)<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span><!--[endif]-->the use of efficient construction materials.<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:21.3pt;text-indent:-21.3pt;mso-list:l0 level2 lfo1"><!--[if !supportLists]-->k)<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span><!--[endif]-->methods to minimise waste, to encourage re-use,
recovery and recycling, and sourcing of materials; and<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:21.3pt;text-indent:-21.3pt;mso-list:l0 level2 lfo1"><!--[if !supportLists]-->l)<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span><!--[endif]-->a nominated Developer/Resident Liaison
Representative with an address and contact telephone number to be circulated to
those residents consulted on the application by the developer’s
representatives. This person will act as first point of contact for residents
who have any problems or questions related to the ongoing development.<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">Demolition and construction work and associated activities,
other than internal works not audible outside the site boundary, are only to be
carried out between the hours of 08:00 and 18:00 Monday to Friday and 08:00 and
13:00 Saturday, with no work on Sundays or public holidays without the prior
written permission of the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; Any works which are
associated with the generation of ground borne vibration are only to be carried
out between the hours of 08:00 and 18:00 Monday to Friday.<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">Demolition and construction work and associated activities
are to be carried out in accordance with the recommendations contained within
British Standard 5228:2009, “Code of practice for noise and vibration control
on construction and open sites”, Parts 1 and 2.<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">Once approved the Plans shall be adhered to throughout the
construction period for the development.<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><br></p>
description: Erection of two-storey building providing 4 one bedroom flats

constraints_details.result: 8 Brook Avenue, Dagenham, Barking And Dagenham, RM10 9TJ
